title: 論語
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 憲問恥。
passages.en: Xian asked what was shameful.

passages.zh: 子曰：「邦有道，穀；邦無道，穀，恥也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "When good government prevails in a state, to be thinking only of salary; and, when bad government prevails, to be thinking, in the same way, only of salary - this is shameful."

passages.zh: 「克、伐、怨、欲不行焉，可以為仁矣？」
passages.en: "When the love of superiority, boasting, resentments, and covetousness are repressed, this may be deemed perfect virtue."

passages.zh: 子曰：「可以為難矣，仁則吾不知也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "This may be regarded as the achievement of what is difficult. But I do not know that it is to be deemed perfect virtue."

passages.zh: 子曰：「士而懷居，不足以為士矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The scholar who cherishes the love of comfort is not fit to be deemed a scholar."

passages.zh: 子曰：「邦有道，危言危行；
passages.en: The Master said, "When good government prevails in a state, language may be lofty and bold, and actions the same.

passages.zh: 邦無道，危行言孫。」
passages.en: When bad government prevails, the actions may be lofty and bold, but the language may be with some reserve."

passages.zh: 子曰：「有德者，必有言。有言者，不必有德。
passages.en: The Master said, "The virtuous will be sure to speak correctly, but those whose speech is good may not always be virtuous.

passages.zh: 仁者，必有勇。勇者，不必有仁。」
passages.en: Men of principle are sure to be bold, but those who are bold may not always be men of principle."

passages.zh: 南宮适問於孔子曰：「羿善射，奡盪舟，俱不得其死然；
passages.en: Nan Gong Kuo, submitting an inquiry to Confucius, said, "Yi was skillful at archery, and Ao could move a boat along upon the land, but neither of them died a natural death.

passages.zh: 禹稷躬稼，而有天下。」
passages.en: Yu and Ji personally wrought at the toils of husbandry, and they became possessors of the kingdom."

passages.zh: 夫子不答，南宮适出。
passages.en: The Master made no reply; but when Nan Gong Kuo went out,

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子哉若人！尚德哉若人！」
passages.en: he said, "A superior man indeed is this! An esteemer of virtue indeed is this!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子而不仁者有矣夫，未有小人而仁者也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Superior men, and yet not always virtuous, there have been, alas! But there never has been a mean man, and, at the same time, virtuous."

passages.zh: 子曰：「愛之，能勿勞乎？忠焉，能勿誨乎？」
passages.en: The Master said, "Can there be love which does not lead to strictness with its object? Can there be loyalty which does not lead to the instruction of its object?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「為命：裨諶草創之，世叔討論之，行人子羽脩飾之，東里子產潤色之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "In preparing the governmental notifications, Pi Shen first made the rough draft; Shi Shu examined and discussed its contents; Zi Yu, the manager of foreign intercourse, then polished the style; and, finally, Zi Chan of Dong Li gave it the proper elegance and finish."

passages.zh: 或問子產。子曰：「惠人也。」
passages.en: Some one asked about Zi Chan. The Master said, "He was a kind man."

passages.zh: 問子西。曰：「彼哉！彼哉！」
passages.en: He asked about Zi Xi. The Master said, "That man! That man!"

passages.zh: 問管仲。曰：「人也。奪伯氏駢邑三百，飯疏食，沒齒，無怨言。」
passages.en: He asked about Guan Zhong. "For him," said the Master, "the city of Pian, with three hundred families, was taken from the chief of the Bo family, who though to the end of his life he had only coarse rice to eat did not utter a murmuring word."

passages.zh: 子曰：「貧而無怨難，富而無驕易。」
passages.en: The Master said, "To be poor without murmuring is difficult. To be rich without being proud is easy."

passages.zh: 子曰：「孟公綽，為趙魏老則優，不可以為滕薛大夫。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Meng Gong Chuo is more than fit to be chief officer in the families of Zhao and Wei, but he is not fit to be great officer to either of the States Teng or Xue."

passages.zh: 子路問成人。
passages.en: Zi Lu asked what constituted a COMPLETE man.

passages.zh: 子曰：「若臧武仲之知，公綽之不欲，卞莊子之勇，冉求之藝，文之以禮樂，亦可以為成人矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Suppose a man with the knowledge of Zang Wu Zhong, the freedom from covetousness of Gong Chuo, the bravery of Zhuang of Bian, and the varied talents of Ran Qiu; add to these the accomplishments of the rules of propriety and music - such a one might be reckoned a COMPLETE man."

passages.zh: 曰：「今之成人者何必然？
passages.en: He then added, "But what is the necessity for a complete man of the present day to have all these things?

passages.zh: 見利思義，見危授命，久要不忘平生之言，亦可以為成人矣。」
passages.en: The man, who in the view of gain, thinks of righteousness; who in the view of danger is prepared to give up his life; and who does not forget an old agreement however far back it extends - such a man may be reckoned a COMPLETE man."

passages.zh: 子問公叔文子於公明賈曰：「信乎夫子不言、不笑、不取乎？」
passages.en: The Master asked Gong Ming Jia about Gong Ming Wen, saying, "Is it true that your master speaks not, laughs not, and takes not?"

passages.zh: 公明賈對曰：「以告者過也。
passages.en: Gong Ming Jia replied, "This has arisen from the reporters going beyond the truth.

passages.zh: 夫子時然後言，人不厭其言；
passages.en: My master speaks when it is the time to speak, and so men do not get tired of his speaking.

passages.zh: 樂然後笑，人不厭其笑；
passages.en: He laughs when there is occasion to be joyful, and so men do not get tired of his laughing.

passages.zh: 義然後取，人不厭其取。」
passages.en: He takes when it is consistent with righteousness to do so, and so men do not get tired of his taking."

passages.zh: 子曰：「其然，豈其然乎？」
passages.en: The Master said, "So! But is it so with him?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「臧武仲以防求為後於魯，雖曰不要君，吾不信也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Zang Wu Zhong, keeping possession of Fang, asked of the duke of Lu to appoint a successor to him in his family. Although it may be said that he was not using force with his sovereign, I believe he was."

passages.zh: 子曰：「晉文公譎而不正，齊桓公正而不譎。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The duke Wen of Jin was crafty and not upright. The duke Huan of Qi was upright and not crafty."

passages.zh: 子路曰：「桓公殺公子糾，召忽死之，管仲不死。」曰：「未仁乎？」
passages.en: Zi Lu said, "The duke Huan caused his brother Jiu to be killed, when Shao Hu died with his master, but Guan Zhong did not die. May not I say that he was wanting in virtue?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「桓公九合諸侯，不以兵車，管仲之力也。如其仁！如其仁！」
passages.en: The Master said, "The Duke Huan assembled all the princes together, and that not with weapons of war and chariots - it was all through the influence of Guan Zhong. Whose beneficence was like his? Whose beneficence was like his?"

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「管仲非仁者與？桓公殺公子糾，不能死，又相之。」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "Guan Zhong, I apprehend, was wanting in virtue. When the Duke Huan caused his brother Jiu to be killed, Guan Zhong was not able to die with him. Moreover, he became prime minister to Huan."

passages.zh: 子曰：「管仲相桓公，霸諸侯，一匡天下，民到于今受其賜。
passages.en: The Master said, "Guan Zhong acted as prime minister to the duke Huan, made him leader of all the princes, and united and rectified the whole kingdom. Down to the present day, the people enjoy the gifts which he conferred.

passages.zh: 微管仲，吾其被髮左衽矣。
passages.en: But for Guan Zhong, we should now be wearing our hair unbound, and the lappets of our coats buttoning on the left side.

passages.zh: 豈若匹夫匹婦之為諒也，自經於溝瀆，而莫之知也。」
passages.en: Will you require from him the small fidelity of common men and common women, who would commit suicide in a stream or ditch, no one knowing anything about them?"

passages.zh: 公叔文子之臣大夫僎，與文子同升諸公。
passages.en: The great officer, Xian, who had been family minister to Gong Ming Wen, ascended to the prince's court in company with Wen.

passages.zh: 子聞之曰：「可以為文矣。」
passages.en: The Master, having heard of it, said, "He deserved to be considered WEN (the accomplished)."

passages.zh: 子言衛靈公之無道也，康子曰：「夫如是，奚而不喪？」
passages.en: The Master was speaking about the unprincipled course of the duke Ling of Wei, when Qi Kang said, "Since he is of such a character, how is it he does not lose his state?"

passages.zh: 孔子曰：「仲叔圉治賓客，祝鮀治宗廟，王孫賈治軍旅。夫如是，奚其喪？」
passages.en: Confucius said, "The Zhong Shu Yu has the superintendence of his guests and of strangers; the litanist, Tuo, has the management of his ancestral temple; and Wang Sun Jia has the direction of the army and forces - with such officers as these, how should he lose his state?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「其言之不怍，則為之也難。」
passages.en: The Master said, "He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good."

passages.zh: 陳成子弒簡公。
passages.en: Chen Cheng murdered the duke Jian of Qi.

passages.zh: 孔子沐浴而朝，告於哀公曰：「陳恆弒其君，請討之。」
passages.en: Confucius bathed, went to court and informed the duke Ai, saying, "Chen Heng has slain his sovereign. I beg that you will undertake to punish him."

passages.zh: 公曰：「告夫三子！」
passages.en: The duke said, "Inform the chiefs of the three families of it."

passages.zh: 孔子曰：「以吾從大夫之後，不敢不告也。君曰『告夫三子』者。」
passages.en: Confucius retired, and said, "Following in the rear of the great officers, I did not dare not to represent such a matter, and my prince says, 'Inform the chiefs of the three families of it.'"

passages.zh: 之三子告，不可。
passages.en: He went to the chiefs, and informed them, but they would not act.

passages.zh: 孔子曰：「以吾從大夫之後，不敢不告也。」
passages.en: Confucius then said, "Following in the rear of the great officers, I did not dare not to represent such a matter."

passages.zh: 子路問事君。
passages.en: Zi Lu asked how a ruler should be served.

passages.zh: 子曰：「勿欺也，而犯之。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Do not impose on him, and, moreover, withstand him to his face."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子上達，小人下達。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The progress of the superior man is upwards; the progress of the mean man is downwards."

passages.zh: 子曰：「古之學者為己，今之學者為人。」
passages.en: The Master said, "In ancient times, men learned with a view to their own improvement. Nowadays, men learn with a view to the approbation of others."

passages.zh: 蘧伯玉使人於孔子。
passages.en: Qu Bo sent a messenger with friendly inquiries to Confucius.

passages.zh: 孔子與之坐而問焉，曰：「夫子何為？」
passages.en: Confucius sat with him, and questioned him. "What," said he! "is your master engaged in?"

passages.zh: 對曰：「夫子欲寡其過而未能也。」
passages.en: The messenger replied, "My master is anxious to make his faults few, but he has not yet succeeded."

passages.zh: 使者出。子曰：「使乎！使乎！」
passages.en: He then went out, and the Master said, "A messenger indeed! A messenger indeed!"

passages.zh: 子曰：「不在其位，不謀其政。」
passages.en: The Master said, "He who is not in any particular office has nothing to do with plans for the administration of its duties."

passages.zh: 曾子曰：「君子思不出其位。」
passages.en: The philosopher Zeng said, "The superior man, in his thoughts, does not go out of his place."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子恥其言而過其行。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions."

passages.zh: 子曰：「君子道者三，我無能焉：仁者不憂，知者不惑，勇者不懼。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The way of the superior man is threefold, but I am not equal to it. Virtuous, he is free from anxieties; wise, he is free from perplexities; bold, he is free from fear."

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子自道也。」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "Master, that is what you yourself say."

passages.zh: 子貢方人。
passages.en: Zi Gong was in the habit of comparing men together.

passages.zh: 子曰：「賜也賢乎哉？夫我則不暇。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Ci must have reached a high pitch of excellence! Now, I have not leisure for this."

passages.zh: 子曰：「不患人之不己知，患其不能也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "I will not be concerned at men's not knowing me; I will be concerned at my own want of ability."

passages.zh: 子曰：「不逆詐，不億不信。抑亦先覺者，是賢乎！」
passages.en: The Master said, "He who does not anticipate attempts to deceive him, nor think beforehand of his not being believed, and yet apprehends these things readily (when they occur) - is he not a man of superior worth?"

passages.zh: 微生畝謂孔子曰：「丘何為是栖栖者與？無乃為佞乎？」
passages.en: Wei Sheng Mu said to Confucius, "Qiu, how is it that you keep roosting about? Is it not that you are an insinuating talker?"

passages.zh: 孔子曰：「非敢為佞也，疾固也。」
passages.en: Confucius said, "I do not dare to play the part of such a talker, but I hate obstinacy."

passages.zh: 子曰：「驥不稱其力，稱其德也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "A horse is called a Ji, not because of its strength, but because of its other good qualities."

passages.zh: 或曰：「以德報怨，何如？」
passages.en: Some one said, "What do you say concerning the principle that injury should be recompensed with kindness?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「何以報德？以直報怨，以德報德。」
passages.en: The Master said, "With what then will you recompense kindness? Recompense injury with justice, and recompense kindness with kindness."

passages.zh: 子曰：「莫我知也夫！」
passages.en: The Master said, "Alas! there is no one that knows me."

passages.zh: 子貢曰：「何為其莫知子也？」
passages.en: Zi Gong said, "What do you mean by thus saying - that no one knows you?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「不怨天，不尤人。下學而上達。知我者，其天乎！」
passages.en: The Master replied, "I do not murmur against Heaven. I do not grumble against men. My studies lie low, and my penetration rises high. But there is Heaven - that knows me!"

passages.zh: 公伯寮愬子路於季孫。
passages.en: The Gong Bo Liao, having slandered Zi Lu to Ji Sun,

passages.zh: 子服景伯以告，曰：「夫子固有惑志於公伯寮，吾力猶能肆諸市朝。」
passages.en: Zi Fu Jing Bo informed Confucius of it, saying, "Our master is certainly being led astray by the Gong Bo Liao, but I have still power enough left to cut Liao off, and expose his corpse in the market and in the court."

passages.zh: 子曰：「道之將行也與？命也。道之將廢也與？命也。公伯寮其如命何！」
passages.en: The Master said, "If my principles are to advance, it is so ordered. If they are to fall to the ground, it is so ordered. What can the Gong Bo Liao do where such ordering is concerned?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「賢者辟世，其次辟地，其次辟色，其次辟言。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Some men of worth retire from the world. Some retire from particular states. Some retire because of disrespectful looks. Some retire because of contradictory language."

passages.zh: 子曰：「作者七人矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Those who have done this are seven men."

passages.zh: 子路宿於石門。
passages.en: Zi Lu happening to pass the night in Shi Men,

passages.zh: 晨門曰：「奚自？」子路曰：「自孔氏。」
passages.en: the gatekeeper said to him, "Whom do you come from?" Zi Lu said, "From Mr. Kong."

passages.zh: 曰：「是知其不可而為之者與？」
passages.en: "It is he, is it not?" said the other, "who knows the impracticable nature of the times and yet will be doing in them."

passages.zh: 子擊磬於衛。
passages.en: The Master was playing, one day, on a musical stone in Wei,

passages.zh: 有荷蕢而過孔氏之門者，曰：「有心哉！擊磬乎！」
passages.en: when a man, carrying a straw basket, passed the door of the house where Confucius was, and said, "His heart is full who so beats the musical stone."

passages.zh: 既而曰：「鄙哉！硜硜乎！莫己知也，斯己而已矣。
passages.en: A little while after, he added, "How contemptible is the one-ideaed obstinacy those sounds display! When one is taken no notice of, he has simply at once to give over his wish for public employment.

passages.zh: 深則厲，淺則揭。」
passages.en: 'Deep water must be crossed with the clothes on; shallow water may be crossed with the clothes held up.'"

passages.zh: 子曰：「果哉！末之難矣。」
passages.en: The Master said, "How determined is he in his purpose! But this is not difficult!"

passages.zh: 子張曰：「《書》云：『高宗諒陰，三年不言。』何謂也？」
passages.en: Zi Zhang said, "When the Shu says that Gao Zong, while observing the usual imperial mourning, was for three years without speaking, what is meant by this?"

passages.zh: 子曰：「何必高宗，古之人皆然。君薨，百官總己以聽於冢宰，三年。」
passages.en: The Master said, "Why must Gao Zong be referred to as an example of this? The ancients all did so. When the sovereign died, the officers all attended to their several duties, taking instructions from the prime minister for three years."

passages.zh: 子曰：「上好禮，則民易使也。」
passages.en: The Master said, "When rulers love to observe the rules of propriety, the people respond readily to the calls on them for service."

passages.zh: 子路問君子。
passages.en: Zi Lu asked what constituted the superior man.

passages.zh: 子曰：「脩己以敬。」
passages.en: The Master said, "The cultivation of himself in reverential carefulness."

passages.zh: 曰：「如斯而已乎？」
passages.en: "And is this all?" said Zi Lu.

passages.zh: 曰：「脩己以安人。」
passages.en: "He cultivates himself so as to give rest to others," was the reply.

passages.zh: 曰：「如斯而已乎？」
passages.en: "And is this all?" again asked Zi Lu.

passages.zh: 曰：「脩己以安百姓。脩己以安百姓，堯舜其猶病諸！」
passages.en: The Master said, "He cultivates himself so as to give rest to all the people. He cultivates himself so as to give rest to all the people - even Yao and Shun were still solicitous about this."

passages.zh: 原壤夷俟。
passages.en: Yuan Rang was squatting on his heels, and so waited the approach of the Master,

passages.zh: 子曰：「幼而不孫弟，長而無述焉，老而不死，是為賊！」
passages.en: who said to him, "In youth not humble as befits a junior; in manhood, doing nothing worthy of being handed down; and living on to old age - this is to be a pest."

passages.zh: 以杖叩其脛。
passages.en: With this he hit him on the shank with his staff.

passages.zh: 闕黨童子將命。
passages.en: A youth of the village of Que was employed by Confucius to carry the messages between him and his visitors.

passages.zh: 或問之曰：「益者與？」
passages.en: Some one asked about him, saying, "I suppose he has made great progress."

passages.zh: 子曰：「吾見其居於位也，見其與先生並行也。
passages.en: The Master said, "I observe that he is fond of occupying the seat of a full-grown man; I observe that he walks shoulder to shoulder with his elders.

passages.zh: 非求益者也，欲速成者也。」
passages.en: He is not one who is seeking to make progress in learning. He wishes quickly to become a man."
